New Records: Rilee Rossouw scored a wonderful ton and became the first South African to score a century in T20 World Cup
Key Match Events: Anrich Nortje took four wickets in his first over, ending with a four-wicket haul, his best T20I figures
Bangladesh lost both openers in quick succession after Anrich Nortje's introduction
Tabraiz Shamsi claimed three wickets for Bangladesh
Bangladesh managed to score 101 in 16.2 overs despite a good start with sixes in the first over
South Africa crossed 200 with the help of terrific innings from Rilee Rossouw and Quinton De Kock
South Africa won by 104 runs against Bangladesh
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa won the toss and decided to bat
Proteas had a top class performance by Rilee Rossouw and Quinton de Kock with the bat
Bangladesh had a good start with sixes in the first over
South Africa displayed top-class bowling, especially the pace bowling from Anrich Nortje and Kagiso Rabada
Post-Match Reflections: South Africa dominated in all three departments and boosted their net rate with such a huge margin win
For now, South Africa go on top of group 2
Miscellaneous Highlights: Anrich Nortje's first over shifted the momentum
Shakib Al Hasan fell to an LBW decision that could have been referred upstairs
Bangladesh fans enjoyed some entertainment from Mustafizur Rahman with his capability with the bat
Tristan Stubbs made a fine catch to dismiss Litton Das
Others: Bangladesh were poor with the ball and in the field, with a few dropped catches and misfields
South Africa registered a big total of 205/5 in 20 overs
Bangladesh managed to score 101 in 16.2 overs
